pullrequest.title: Add mex wrappers for sim API

content.raw:
`<from_your_haptix-comm-repo>sh tools/code_check.sh` (you need cppcheck installed).

But this is not going to work because we are not parsing the `matlab` directory. If you look into `code_check.sh` there's a variable for specifying the directories that the checker needs to check (`CHECK_DIRS`). I played a little bit with that variable and with the `CPPCHECK_FILES` variable but for some reason didn't work. So, my workaround to see the output was to copy `hxgz.c` into the `src/` directory and renamed to `.cc`. 

And about the spacing, we don't usually have the space before the opening parenthesis but probably not a big deal.
content.html:
<from_your_haptix-comm-repo>sh tools/code_check.sh (you need cppcheck installed).

But this is not going to work because we are not parsing the matlab directory. If you look into code_check.sh there's a variable for specifying the directories that the checker needs to check (CHECK_DIRS). I played a little bit with that variable and with the CPPCHECK_FILES variable but for some reason didn't work. So, my workaround to see the output was to copy hxgz.c into the src/ directory and renamed to .cc.

And about the spacing, we don't usually have the space before the opening parenthesis but probably not a big deal.

pullrequest.title: Add mex wrappers for sim API

content.raw:
f78645d uses `fprintf` to format the output, which now looks like this:

~~~
Models:
  ground_plane
    Links:
      link
    Joints:
  table
    Links:
      link
    Joints:
  wooden_case
    Links:
      base
      lid
    Joints:
      lid_hinge
~~~

pullrequest.title: Add mex wrappers for sim API

content.raw: Similar to the comment about `mxGetPr` vs `mxGetData`: yes, I think that it would be more correct to use the API calls that are specific to integers, but passing doubles around like this seems to work fine, so I'm inclined to leave it as is.  If anybody encounters (or can predict) a problem with this method, then I'll happily change it.
content.html: Similar to the comment about mxGetPr vs mxGetData: yes, I think that it would be more correct to use the API calls that are specific to integers, but passing doubles around like this seems to work fine, so I'm inclined to leave it as is. If anybody encounters (or can predict) a problem with this method, then I'll happily change it.

pullrequest.title: Add mex wrappers for sim API

content.raw:
I made a few changes to make the example work on MATLAB in 137863c . Summary:

* MATLAB doesn't like double quotes for string literals. It prefers single quotes.
* There is no autoincrement (and friends) operator.
* There's no `sleep()`. The alternative is `pause()` that we learned before is not really accurate.
content.html:
I made a few changes to make the example work on MATLAB in 137863c . Summary:

  • MATLAB doesn't like double quotes for string literals. It prefers single quotes.
  • There is no autoincrement (and friends) operator.
  • There's no sleep(). The alternative is pause() that we learned before is not really accurate.
